sense.name: a riding horse
sense.examples: The cavalry train their mounts to charge in to battle. Mary will ride three different mounts in the horse show.

sense.name: the act of climbing up something
sense.examples: They continued their slow mount of the northern face of the hill. Just contemplating the mount of the 300 stairs up the lighthouse made Bob tired.

sense.name: a mountain, hill, peak
sense.commentary: MOUNT[+form][+natural][+land][+mountain] Note: somewhat dated usage except in a proper name, e.g, Mount Everest
sense.examples: It's one of the tallest mounts in that range.

sense.name: a backing or setting on which to display an object
sense.examples: Sally is having the silver mount of her diamond ring replaced with a gold one. The biologist prepared several mounts with specimens and examined them under a microscope. He used a simple cardboard mount to back the picture in the frame.

sense.name: a support for a device such as a camera or telescope
sense.examples: They put the camera on a special mount in order to follow the race car at close proximity. This telescope has a motorized mount to compensate for the earth's rotation. These iron attachments on the old fort are probably gun mounts.

sense.name: an opportunity to ride a racehorse in a race
sense.examples: The jockey's injuries forced him to give up the coveted mount on Sea Biscuit.
